efface.中释: 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意

impugn.中释: 指责，非难；抨击；反驳；对…表示怀疑
impugn.英释: to express doubts about someone’s honesty, courage, ability etc

median.英释: being the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order

torrid.英释: involving strong emotions, especially of sexual love

dilate.英释: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

entity.英释: something that exists as a single and complete unit

append.中释: 设置数据文件的搜索路径

canine.英释: one of the four sharp pointed teeth in the front of your mouth

column.中释: 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物
column.英释: a tall solid upright stone post used to support a building or as a decoration

deduce.英释: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

votary.英释: ardently devoted to the services or worship of God, a deity, or a saint

deduct.英释: to take away an amount or part from a total

tawdry.中释: 俗丽的东西；廉价而俗丽之物

lament.英释: to express feelings of great sadness about something

peruse.英释: to read something, especially in a careful way

recant.英释: to say publicly that you no longer have a political or religious belief that you had before

branch.英释: a part of a tree that grows out from the  trunk (=  main stem  )  and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

astute.中释: 机敏的；狡猾的，诡计多端的
astute.英释: able to understand situations or behaviour very well and very quickly, especially so that you can get an advantage for yourself

pepsin.英释: a liquid in your stomach that changes food into a form that your body can use

retort.英释: to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

foster.中释: (Foster)人名；(英、捷、意、葡、法、德、俄、西)福斯特

drowsy.中释: 昏昏欲睡的；沉寂的；催眠的

genome.英释: all the  genes  in one type of living thing

errant.中释: 不定的；周游的；错误的；偏离正路的
errant.英释: Errant is used to describe someone whose actions are considered unacceptable or wrong by other people. For example, an errant husband is unfaithful to his wife.

accede.英释: When a member of a royal family accedes to the throne, they become king or queen

deride.英释: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

appeal.中释: 呼吁，请求；吸引力，感染力；上诉；诉诸裁判
appeal.英释: an urgent request for something important

futile.中释: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
futile.英释: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

medium.英释: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc

aviary.英释: a large  cage  where birds are kept

biased.中释: 有偏见的；结果偏倚的，有偏的
biased.英释: unfairly preferring one person or group over another

infuse.英释: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

timbre.英释: the quality of the sound made by a particular instrument or voice

impute.英释: If you impute something such as blame or a crime to someone, you say that they are responsible for it or are the cause of it

bowler.中释: 圆顶礼帽；投球手；玩滚球的人
bowler.英释: a player in  cricket  who throws the ball at a  batsman

soothe.英释: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

gallop.中释: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
gallop.英释: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

insure.英释: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

Oxygen.英释: Oxygen is a colourless gas that exists in large quantities in the air. All plants and animals need oxygen in order to live.

breach.英释: to break a law, rule, or agreement

pursue.英释: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

plague.英释: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

ravine.英释: a deep narrow valley with steep sides

charge.中释: 使充电；使承担；指责；装载；对…索费；向…冲去
charge.英释: to say publicly that you think someone has done something wrong

gloomy.英释: making you feel that things will not improve

visual.中释: 视觉的，视力的；栩栩如生的

apathy.中释: 冷漠，无兴趣，漠不关心；无感情
apathy.英释: the feeling of not being interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things

zenith.英释: the most successful point in the development of something

robust.中释: 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的
robust.英释: a robust person is strong and healthy

revere.英释: to respect and admire someone or something very much

cornea.英释: the transparent protective covering on the outer surface of your eye

upshot.英释: the final result of a situation

facile.中释: （言语或理论）轻率的，未经深思熟虑的

remiss.中释: 怠慢的；迟缓的；不小心的
remiss.英释: If someone is remiss, they are careless about doing things that ought to be done

neuron.英释: a type of cell that makes up the nervous system and sends messages to other parts of the body or the brain

harass.中释: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击
harass.英释: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

purity.中释: [化学] 纯度；纯洁；纯净；纯粹
purity.英释: the quality or state of being pure

ribald.中释: 言谈粗俗的人；说下流话的人

beaker.英释: a drinking cup with straight sides and no handle, usually made of plastic

decent.中释: 正派的；得体的；相当好的
decent.英释: of a good enough standard or quality

elicit.英释: to succeed in getting information or a reaction from someone, especially when this is difficult

clergy.英释: the official leaders of religious activities in organized religions, such as priests,  rabbi s  , and  mullah s

pallid.中释: 苍白的；暗淡的；无生气的
pallid.英释: very pale, especially in a way that looks weak or unhealthy

forage.英释: to go around searching for food or other supplies

script.英释: The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

plural.英释: a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

bursar.中释: 财务主管；会计员；领取奖学金的学生
bursar.英释: someone at a school or college who deals with the accounts and office work

outlaw.中释: 宣布…为不合法；将…放逐；剥夺…的法律保护
outlaw.英释: When something is outlawed, it is made illegal

cajole.英释: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

urbane.中释: 彬彬有礼的，温文尔雅的；都市化的
urbane.英释: behaving in a relaxed and confident way in social situations

gypsum.英释: a soft white substance that is used to make  plaster of paris

apogee.中释: 位于远地点；位于最高点

stigma.中释: [植] 柱头；耻辱；污名；烙印；特征
stigma.英释: a strong feeling in society that being in a particular situation or having a particular illness is something to be ashamed of

occult.英释: mysterious practices and powers involving magic and spirits

rapine.英释: the seizure of property by force; pillage

dearth.英释: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

bridge.英释: to build or form a bridge over something

stupor.英释: a state in which you cannot think, speak, see, or hear clearly, usually because you have drunk too much alcohol or taken drugs

evolve.中释: 发展，进化；进化；使逐步形成；推断出
evolve.英释: if an animal or plant evolves, it changes gradually over a long period of time

shriek.英释: a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc

esteem.英释: a feeling of respect for someone, or a good opinion of someone

redeem.中释: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复

torque.中释: (向轴、螺栓、圆轮等)施以扭动力；(使)沿轴转动；使(绕轴等)扭转；施加转矩

bustle.中释: 喧闹；活跃；裙撑；热闹的活动

assess.英释: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

nebula.英释: a mass of gas and dust among the stars, which often appears as a bright cloud in the sky at night

assert.中释: 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称
assert.英释: to state firmly that something is true

caucus.中释: 召开干部会议；开核心会议

abrupt.中释: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的

commit.中释: 犯罪，做错事；把交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务
commit.英释: to do something wrong or illegal

humble.中释: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
humble.英释: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

vivify.中释: 使生动；使活跃；给与生气

ethnic.英释: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

relish.中释: 盼望;期待;享受; 品味；喜爱；给…加佐料
relish.英释: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen

malice.英释: the desire to harm someone because you hate them

bauble.中释: 小玩意；美观而无价值的饰物

tripod.英释: a support with three legs, used for a piece of equipment, camera etc

acumen.英释: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

length.中释: 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长
length.英释: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

abjure.中释: 发誓放弃；公开放弃；避免
abjure.英释: to state publicly that you will give up a particular belief or way of behaving

access.英释: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc

accuse.英释: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

innate.中释: 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的
innate.英释: an innate quality or ability is something you are born with

summon.英释: to order someone to come to a place

alcove.英释: a place in the wall of a room that is built further back than the rest of the wall

votive.中释: 奉献的（副词votively）；献纳的；诚心祈求的
votive.英释: offered, given, undertaken, performed or dedicated in fulfilment of or in accordance with a vow

triple.英释: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

matter.英释: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

assent.英释: approval or agreement from someone who has authority

canary.英释: a small yellow bird that people often keep as a pet

ironic.英释: an ironic situation is one that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

ritual.中释: 仪式的；例行的；礼节性的
ritual.英释: done in a fixed and expected way, but without real meaning or sincerity

patter.中释: 滴答地响；急速地说；发出急速轻拍声
patter.英释: if something, especially water, patters, it makes quiet sounds as it keeps hitting a surface lightly and quickly

fervid.英释: believing or feeling something too strongly

myriad.中释: 无数，极大数量；无数的人或物
myriad.英释: a very large number of things

aghast.英释: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

tumult.英释: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd

refute.英释: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

impend.英释: (esp of something threatening) to be about to happen; be imminent

orator.中释: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
orator.英释: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

asylum.英释: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

surety.英释: someone who will pay a debt, appear in court etc if someone else fails to do so

verify.英释: to discover whether something is correct or true

nuclei.中释: 核心，核子；原子核（nucleus的复数形式）

sensor.英释: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

gossip.英释: If you gossip with someone, you talk informally, especially about other people or local events. You can also say that two people gossip.

impede.英释: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

exceed.英释: to be more than a particular number or amount

sedate.英释: to give someone drugs to make them calm or to make them sleep

fusion.中释: 融合；熔化；熔接；融合物；[物] 核聚变
fusion.英释: a combination of separate qualities or ideas

detach.英释: If you detach one thing from another that it is attached to, you remove it. If one thing detaches from another, it becomes separated from it.

unruly.中释: 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的

coddle.中释: 娇养；溺爱（等于mollycoddle）；用文火煮
coddle.英释: to treat someone in a way that is too kind and gentle and that protects them from pain or difficulty

ambush.英释: If a group of people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them

digest.英释: a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

vacuum.英释: to clean using a vacuum cleaner

annual.英释: a plant that lives for one year or season

inject.英释: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

modify.英释: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

energy.英释: power that is used to provide heat, operate machines etc

frowzy.中释: 不整洁的（等于frowsy）；有臭味的；霉臭的

stanza.英释: a group of lines in a repeated pattern forming part of a poem

secant.英释: (of an angle) a trigonometric function that in a right-angled triangle is the ratio of the length of the hypotenuse to that of the adjacent side; the reciprocal of cosine

badger.英释: to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times

becalm.中释: 使安静；使停滞；因无风而使停航

berate.英释: to speak angrily to someone because they have done something wrong

divide.英释: a line of high ground between two river systems

humane.英释: treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible

belief.英释: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

myopia.中释: [眼科] 近视；目光短浅，缺乏远见
myopia.英释: when someone does not think about the future, especially about the possible results of a particular action – used in order to show disapproval

corpse.英释: the dead body of a person

latest.中释: 最新的，最近的；最迟的，最后的
latest.英释: the most recent or the newest

frugal.中释: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
frugal.英释: careful to buy only what is necessary

arrear.中释: 欠款，逾期债款；待完成的工作

gaiety.中释: 快乐，兴高采烈；庆祝活动，喜庆；（服饰）华丽，艳丽
gaiety.英释: when someone or something is cheerful and fun

bisect.英释: to divide something into two equal parts

radius.中释: 半径，半径范围；[解剖] 桡骨；辐射光线；有效航程
radius.英释: the distance from the centre to the edge of a circle, or a line drawn from the centre to the edge

legacy.英释: something that happens or exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time

switch.英释: a piece of equipment that starts or stops the flow of electricity to a machine, light etc when you push it

artery.英释: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

kernel.中释: 核心，要点；[计] 内核；仁；麦粒，谷粒；精髓
kernel.英释: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

venial.中释: 可原谅的；（罪过）轻微的；可宽恕的
venial.英释: a venial fault, mistake etc is not very serious and can be forgiven

degree.英释: a unit for measuring temperature. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 70° means 70 degrees.

verity.英释: an important principle or fact that is always true

latent.英释: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

litmus.英释: a chemical that turns red when it touches acid, and blue when it touches an alkali

armful.英释: the amount of something that you can hold in one or both arms

eschew.英释: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

kidney.英释: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine

solemn.中释: 庄严的，严肃的；隆重的，郑重的
solemn.英释: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

allude.中释: 暗指，转弯抹角地说到；略为提及，顺便提到
allude.英释: If you allude to something, you mention it in an indirect way

wretch.中释: 可怜的人，不幸的人；卑鄙的人
wretch.英释: someone that you feel sorry for

domain.英释: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

linear.中释: 线的，线型的；直线的，线状的；长度的
linear.英释: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

docile.中释: 温顺的，驯服的；容易教的

turgid.英释: full and swollen with liquid or air

abbess.中释: 女修道院院长；女庵主持
abbess.英释: a woman who is in charge of a  convent (=  a place where a group of  nun s  live  )

ornate.中释: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
ornate.英释: covered with a lot of decoration

quaint.中释: 古雅的；奇怪的；离奇有趣的；做得很精巧的
quaint.英释: Something that is quaint is attractive because it is old-fashioned

regime.中释: 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制
regime.英释: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

vilify.英释: to say or write bad things about someone or something

strait.英释: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas

utmost.英释: You can use utmost to emphasize the importance or seriousness of something or to emphasize the way that it is done

auburn.英释: auburn hair is a reddish brown colour

temper.中释: 使回火；锻炼；调和；使缓和
temper.英释: to make something less severe or extreme

enmity.英释: Enmity is a feeling of hatred toward someone that lasts for a long time

glance.中释: 扫视，匆匆一看；反光；瞥闪，瞥见
glance.英释: to quickly look at someone or something

endure.英释: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

ethics.中释: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
ethics.英释: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

theory.英释: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

butane.英释: a gas stored in liquid form, used for cooking and heating

nausea.英释: the feeling that you have when you think you are going to vomit (= bring food up from your stomach through your mouth )

potent.中释: 有效的；强有力的，有权势的；有说服力的
potent.英释: having a very powerful effect or influence on your body or mind

nimble.英释: able to move quickly and easily with light neat movements

hadron.中释: [高能] 强子（参与强相互作用的基本粒子）
hadron.英释: any elementary particle capable of taking part in a strong nuclear interaction and therefore excluding leptons and photons

descry.英释: to discern or make out; catch sight of

induct.中释: 引导；感应；使…就职；征召入伍
induct.英释: to officially give someone a job or position of authority, especially at a special ceremony

induce.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

string.英释: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

cancer.英释: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

amount.英释: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

submit.英释: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

putrid.中释: 腐败的；腐烂的；令人厌恶的
putrid.英释: dead animals, plants etc that are putrid are decaying and smell very bad

gamble.英释: an action or plan that involves a risk but that you hope will succeed

expend.英释: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

muddle.英释: when there is confusion about something, and things are done wrong as a result

pathos.中释: 悲怅；痛苦；同情；哀婉动人的词句

hiatus.英释: a space where something is missing, especially in a piece of writing

artful.中释: 巧妙的；狡猾的；有技巧的；欺诈的

expect.英释: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

phonic.中释: 有声的，浊音的；声音的，语音的；声学的

apiece.英释: costing or having a particular amount each

cogent.英释: if a statement is cogent, it seems reasonable and correct

propel.英释: to move, drive, or push something forward

armory.中释: [军] 军械库；[军] 兵工厂（等于armoury）

somber.中释: 忧郁的；昏暗的；严峻的；阴天的

excess.英释: additional and not needed because there is already enough of something

object.英释: to state a fact or opinion as a reason for opposing or disapproving of something

urgent.英释: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

morass.中释: 沼泽；困境；乱糟糟的一堆
morass.英释: a complicated and confusing situation that is very difficult to get out of

enzyme.英释: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal

native.英释: someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

hazard.英释: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

senile.中释: 高龄的；老衰的；高龄所致的
senile.英释: If old people become senile, they become confused, can no longer remember things, and are unable to take care of themselves

height.英释: how tall someone or something is

sordid.中释: 肮脏的；卑鄙的；利欲熏心的；色彩暗淡的

breech.中释: 给…穿上裤子；给…装上炮尾

lavish.英释: to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

effete.中释: 衰老的；疲惫的；（土地）贫瘠的；（动植物）不育的

truism.中释: 自明之理；老生常谈；老套；众所周知；真实性
truism.英释: a statement that is clearly true, so that there is no need to say it

adroit.英释: clever and skilful, especially in the way you use words and arguments

ballad.中释: 歌谣，民谣；叙事歌谣；流行抒情歌曲

albeit.英释: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

elated.中释: 使兴奋（elate的过去式和过去分词）

onrush.英释: a strong fast movement forward, or the sudden development of something

slogan.英释: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

nestle.中释: 舒适地坐定；偎依；半隐半现地处于
nestle.英释: to move into a comfortable position, pressing your head or body against someone or against something soft

pedant.中释: 学究；书呆子；卖弄学问的人；空谈家
pedant.英释: someone who pays too much attention to rules or to small unimportant details, especially someone who criticizes other people in an extremely annoying way

hoarse.英释: if you are hoarse, or if your voice is hoarse, you speak in a low rough voice, for example because your throat is sore

rookie.英释: someone who has just started doing a job and has little experience

optics.英释: the scientific study of light and the way we see

penury.英释: the state of being very poor

afresh.英释: if you do something afresh, you do it again from the beginning

infest.中释: 骚扰；寄生于；大批出没；大批滋生
infest.英释: if insects, rats etc infest a place, there are a lot of them and they usually cause damage

circle.英释: to move in the shape of a circle around something, especially in the air

morale.英释: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

primer.中释: 初级读本；识字课本；原始物
primer.英释: a school book that contains very basic facts about a subject

solder.英释: a soft metal, usually a mixture of  lead  and  tin  , which can be melted and used to join two metal surfaces, wires etc

extant.英释: still existing in spite of being very old

placid.英释: a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to

liable.中释: 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的
liable.英释: legally responsible for the cost of something

muffle.中释: 低沉的声音；消声器；包裹物（如头巾，围巾等）；唇鼻部

morbid.中释: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的
morbid.英释: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

advent.中释: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
advent.英释: the time when something first begins to be widely used

supine.中释: 仰卧的；懒散的；掌心向上的；向后靠的

revive.中释: 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神
revive.英释: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

hectic.中释: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
hectic.英释: very busy or full of activity

typify.中释: 代表；作为…的典型；具有…的特点
typify.英释: to be a typical example of something

plasma.中释: [等离子] 等离子体；血浆；[矿物] 深绿玉髓
plasma.英释: the yellowish liquid part of blood that contains the blood cells

delude.中释: 欺骗；哄骗；诱惑；【罕用】迷惑；逃避；使失望
delude.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true

starch.英释: to make cloth stiff, using starch

magnet.中释: 磁铁；[电磁] 磁体；磁石
magnet.英释: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

leaven.中释: 酵母；酵素；潜移默化的影响
leaven.英释: a substance, especially yeast, that is added to a mixture of flour and water so that it will swell and can be baked into bread

jovial.中释: 天性快活的；主神朱庇特的
jovial.英释: If you describe a person as jovial, you mean that they are happy and behave in a cheerful way

pacify.英释: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset

covert.中释: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的

vertex.中释: 顶点；[昆] 头顶；[天] 天顶
vertex.英释: the point where two lines meet to form an angle, especially the point of a triangle

shield.英释: to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

bedeck.英释: to decorate something such as a building or street by hanging things all over it

ramify.英释: to divide into branches or branchlike parts

casual.中释: 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

uproot.中释: 根除，连根拔起；迫使某人离开出生地或定居处

revile.英释: to express hatred of someone or something

parody.英释: to copy someone or something in a way that makes people laugh

acquit.中释: 无罪释放；表现；脱卸义务和责任；清偿
acquit.英释: to do something well, especially something difficult that you do for the first time in front of other people

incite.英释: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

pundit.英释: someone who is often asked to give their opinion publicly of a situation or subject

trough.中释: 水槽，水槽；低谷期；饲料槽；低气压
trough.英释: a long narrow open container that holds water or food for animals

bedlam.中释: 混乱，骚乱；精神病院，疯人院
bedlam.英释: a situation where there is a lot of noise and confusion

subdue.英释: to defeat or control a person or group, especially using force

hermit.中释: （尤指宗教原因的）隐士；隐居者
hermit.英释: someone who lives alone and has a simple way of life, usually for religious reasons

dilute.英释: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

recede.英释: When something such as a quality, problem, or illness recedes, it becomes weaker, smaller, or less intense

emblem.中释: 象征；用符号表示；用纹章装饰

venous.英释: relating to the veins(= tubes that carry blood ) in your body

fecund.中释: 肥沃的；多产的；丰饶的；生殖力旺盛的
fecund.英释: able to produce many children, young animals, or crops

detest.英释: to hate something or someone very much

annals.英释: used in the titles of official records of events or activities

moment.中释: 片刻，瞬间，时刻；重要，契机

relent.中释: 变温和，变宽厚；减弱；缓和
relent.英释: to change your attitude and become less strict or cruel towards someone

rotary.中释: 旋转式机器；[动力] 转缸式发动机

fallow.英释: to leave (land) unseeded after ploughing and harrowing it

bigamy.英释: the crime of being married to two people at the same time

subtle.中释: 微妙的；精细的；敏感的；狡猾的；稀薄的
subtle.英释: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

buffer.英释: to reduce the bad effects of something

coerce.英释: to force someone to do something they do not want to do by threatening them

tundra.中释: [生态] 苔原；[地理] 冻原；冻土地带
tundra.英释: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

scanty.中释: 缺乏的；吝啬的；仅有的；稀疏的
scanty.英释: You describe something as scanty when there is less of it than you think there should be

ramble.英释: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

resent.英释: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

quorum.英释: the smallest number of people who must be present at a meeting so that official decisions can be made

exotic.中释: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
exotic.英释: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

denude.英释: to remove the plants and trees that cover an area of land

invoke.英释: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

satire.中释: 讽刺；讽刺文学，讽刺作品
satire.英释: a way of criticizing something such as a group of people or a system, in which you deliberately make them seem funny so that people will see their faults

guilty.英释: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

obtuse.中释: 迟钝的；圆头的；不锋利的
obtuse.英释: slow to understand things, in a way that is annoying

imbibe.英释: to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously

adduce.英释: to give facts or reasons in order to prove that something is true

enamor.英释: to inspire with love; captivate; charm

feudal.中释: 封建制度的；领地的；世仇的

vermin.英释: small animals, birds, and insects that are harmful because they destroy crops, spoil food, and spread disease

cortex.英释: the outer layer of an organ in your body, especially your brain

global.英释: affecting or including the whole world

minute.中释: 微小的，详细的 [maɪˈnjuːt; US -ˈnuːt; maɪˋnut]

dipper.中释: 长柄勺；浸染工；[鸟] 河鸟
dipper.英释: a small bird that finds its food in streams

stolid.中释: 迟钝的；缺乏热情的；冷漠的

savage.英释: if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly

photon.中释: [物] 光子；辐射量子；见光度（等于light quantum）
photon.英释: a unit of  energy  that carries light and has  zero mass

minnow.英释: a very small fish that lives in rivers and lakes

jargon.英释: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval

divest.英释: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it

ensure.英释: to make certain that something will happen properly

unduly.中释: 过度地；不适当地；不正当地
unduly.英释: more than is normal or reasonable

rustic.英释: someone from the country, especially a farm worker

bounce.英释: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it

rebuff.英释: If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest

aerate.中释: 充气；让空气进入；使暴露于空气中
aerate.英释: to put a gas or air into a liquid or into soil

miasma.英释: dirty air or a thick unpleasant mist that smells bad

vacate.英释: to leave a job or position so that it is available for someone else to do

homily.英释: advice about how to behave that is often unwanted

foible.英释: a small weakness or strange habit that someone has, which does not harm anyone else

source.英释: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

convey.英释: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

dispel.英释: to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling

vendor.中释: 卖主；小贩；供应商；[贸易] 自动售货机
vendor.英释: someone who sells things, especially on the street

secede.英释: if a country or state secedes from another country, it officially stops being part of it and becomes independent

outcry.中释: 强烈抗议；大声疾呼；尖叫；倒彩
outcry.英释: an angry protest by a lot of ordinary people

debunk.中释: 揭穿；拆穿…的假面具；暴露

defect.英释: to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

census.英释: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

potion.英释: a drink intended to have a special or magical effect on the person who drinks it, or which is intended to poison them

blazon.英释: a conventional description or depiction of heraldic arms

genial.中释: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的

aspire.英释: to desire and work towards achieving something important

abject.中释: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

torpor.英释: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example, because of illness or laziness

bureau.英释: a government department or a part of a government department in the US

fickle.中释: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
fickle.英释: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

static.英释: noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

kismet.英释: the things that will happen to you in your life

thesis.英释: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

simile.英释: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

arrant.中释: 极恶的；声名狼藉的；彻头彻尾的
arrant.英释: used to emphasize how bad something is

censor.中释: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
censor.英释: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

fluent.中释: 流畅的，流利的；液态的；畅流的
fluent.英释: able to speak a language very well

modest.中释: (Modest)人名；(罗)莫代斯特；(德)莫德斯特；(俄)莫杰斯特

prolix.英释: a prolix piece of writing has too many words and is boring

unused.英释: not being used, or never used

greedy.英释: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

loathe.英释: to hate someone or something very much

foment.英释: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government

funnel.中释: 通过漏斗或烟囱等；使成漏斗形

torpid.中释: 迟钝的，迟缓的；不活泼的；麻痹的；[生物] 蛰伏的
torpid.英释: not active because you are lazy or sleepy

zealot.中释: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
zealot.英释: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

furrow.英释: to make a wide deep line in the surface of something

mirror.英释: if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

levity.英释: lack of respect or seriousness when you are dealing with something serious

status.中释: 地位；状态；情形；重要身份
status.英释: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

herald.英释: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon

barrel.英释: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc

output.英释: if a computer outputs information, it produces it

devoid.英释: If you say that someone or something is devoid of a quality or thing, you are emphasizing that they have none of it

affair.中释: 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事
affair.英释: public or political events and activities

aerial.英释: a piece of equipment for receiving or sending radio or television signals, usually consisting of a piece of metal or wire

ampere.中释: 安培（计算电流强度的标准单位）

spider.英释: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

tremor.英释: If an event causes a tremor in a group or organization, it threatens to make the group or organization less strong or stable

averse.英释: unwilling to do something or not liking something

midway.英释: If something is midway between two places, it is between them and the same distance from each of them

unveil.英释: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

repine.英释: to be fretful or low-spirited through discontent

ossify.英释: to become unwilling to consider new ideas or change your behaviour

impale.英释: if someone or something is impaled, a sharp pointed object goes through them

ratify.英释: to make a written agreement official by signing it

brooch.英释: a piece of jewellery that you fasten to your clothes, usually worn by women

bemoan.英释: to complain or say that you are disappointed about something

frigid.英释: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

series.中释: 系列，连续；[电] 串联；级数；丛书
series.英释: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

homage.英释: something you do to show respect for someone or something you think is important

abrade.英释: to rub something so hard that the surface becomes damaged

armada.英释: An armada is a large group of warships

ration.英释: a fixed amount of something that people are allowed to have when there is not enough, for example during a war

liquid.英释: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk

absorb.中释: 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注
absorb.英释: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

influx.中释: 流入；汇集；河流的汇集处

option.中释: [计] 选项；选择权；买卖的特权
option.英释: a choice you can make in a particular situation

exhale.英释: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

nuance.英释: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

proton.英释: a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical  charge  that is in the central part of an atom

stifle.中释: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

inborn.英释: an inborn quality or ability is one you have had naturally since birth

mirage.英释: an effect caused by hot air in a desert, which makes you think that you can see objects when they are not actually there

expand.英释: if a company, business etc expands, or if someone expands it, they open new shops, factories etc

emerge.英释: to appear or come out from somewhere

solace.中释: 安慰；抚慰；使快乐（过去式solaced，过去分词solaced，现在分词solacing，第三人称单数solaces）

clumsy.英释: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

weight.英释: If you weight something, you make it heavier by adding something to it, for example, in order to stop it from moving easily

vortex.中释: [航][流] 涡流；漩涡；（动乱，争论等的）中心；旋风
vortex.英释: a mass of wind or water that spins quickly and pulls things into its centre

ascent.英释: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

impair.英释: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

attest.英释: to show or prove that something is true

stingy.中释: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的

impact.中释: 挤入，压紧；撞击；对…产生影响
impact.英释: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something

queasy.中释: 呕吐的；不稳定的；催吐的
queasy.英释: feeling that you are going to vomit

filter.中释: 滤波器；[化工] 过滤器；筛选；滤光器
filter.英释: something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

aurora.英释: an atmospheric phenomenon consisting of bands, curtains, or streamers of light, usually green, red, or yellow, that move across the sky in polar regions

origin.英释: the place or situation in which something begins to exist
